articles.title: A quantitative spatial methodology for delimiting historical centers - an application in Guarda, Portugal
articles.abstract: This study employs a morphological approach examining building age data across eight periods spanning 1919-2011. Researchers conducted statistical analysis using threshold values and five novel building indexes, combined with GIS spatial analysis. The work identifies that the historical center of Guarda was consolidated in the 1960s and, since then, has been relatively unchanged. Results demonstrate suitable spatial alignment with consolidated urban areas and official Urban Rehabilitation Area boundaries.

articles.title: An Etrusco-Italic Antefix of Potnia Theron from Ardea
articles.abstract: The article examines an unpublished terracotta architectural ornament featuring a female deity figure. The object originates from Ardea in Latium and dates to the 3rd century B.C. The iconography represents a strong nature goddess laden with symbolic apotropaic powers appearing in religious and public contexts throughout Etruscan and Central Italian regions from the 7th to 1st century B.C.

articles.title: Beach-ridge formation as a possible indicator for an open Limfjord - North Sea connection
articles.abstract: Research employing optically stimulated luminescence dating of beach ridges at Gjellerodde demonstrates three distinct periods of beach-ridge formation coincide with periods when the Limfjord was open towards the North Sea. The study documents correlations with Late Holocene sea-level fluctuations, estimating approximately 0.2 mm/yr relative sea-level fall during the Late Holocene.

articles.title: First report of the parasitoid wasp Trissolcus basalis (Wollaston, 1858) in Austria
articles.abstract: Discovery of parasitized egg clutches from the southern green stink bug in Viennese private gardens during summer 2021, identified through morphological and molecular analysis as the egg parasitoid Trissolcus basalis. This represents the first documented occurrence of this species parasitizing stink bug eggs in Austria.

articles.title: Analysis of the Housing Market Dynamics Using NARX Neural Network
articles.abstract: The research applies nonlinear autoregressive neural networks to model the dynamics of the housing construction market in Poland across developer and individual investor segments, analyzing 19 years of construction approval and completion data to reveal distinct market patterns.

authors.affiliation: Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Opole University of Technology
Institute of Informatics, University of Opole
Faculty of Economics, University of Opole
Narodowy Bank Polski, Regional Branch in Opole

articles.title: Revisiting Conditional Typology for Bangla
articles.abstract: The research examines two conditional formation strategies in Bangla: Correlative and Participial Conditionals, demonstrating functional distinctions supporting semantic theories that equate Hypothetical and Biscuit Conditionals. The analysis extends to the then-word 'tahole' and proposes a pragmatic explanation for the conditional participle '-le', ultimately raising unresolved syntactic classification questions.

articles.title: Crowdsourcing air temperature data for the evaluation of the urban microscale model PALM - a case study in central Europe
articles.abstract: This study evaluates the PALM microscale urban climate model using crowdsourced temperature data from Netatmo citizen weather stations during a heat event in Bochum, Germany. The research demonstrates strong model performance with R-squared values of 0.86-0.88 and RMSE around 2 K, though nighttime temperatures were underestimated. The authors conclude that crowdsourced air temperature data proved valuable for model evaluation due to the high number of stations within urban areas.

articles.title: Post-Brexit Power of European Union From the World Trade Network Analysis
articles.abstract: The research employs Google matrix methodology to examine multiproduct trade networks using UN COMTRADE data. Key findings indicate the EU-27 ranks first in global trade influence ahead of USA and China following Brexit, outperforming traditional import-export analyses.

authors.affiliation: Toulouse Institute of Computer Science Research
Toulouse Institute of Computer Science Research

articles.title: Islam and the Perception of Islam in Contemporary Indonesia
articles.abstract: The paper examines post-reformasi Indonesian Islam through scholarly literature, questioning the dominant Islamization framework. It argues that older cultural styles and variations within local Islam have not disappeared and cautions against using single labels to characterize Islamic development in the region.

articles.title: A record of magmatic differentiation in plutonic xenoliths from Santorini (Greece)
articles.abstract: The research examines plutonic xenoliths from Santorini volcano, analyzing mineral compositions and melt inclusions to understand magmatic differentiation processes. Findings indicate fractional crystallisation as the dominant differentiation process with no significant role of reactive porous flow.

authors.affiliation: GEOMAR Helmholtz Centre for Ocean Research Kiel
GEOMAR Helmholtz Centre for Ocean Research Kiel

articles.title: The Coins from the 2023 Excavation Season of the German-Israeli Tell Iztabba Excavation Project
articles.abstract: The report catalogs 44 coins from the 2023 excavation across three areas, spanning Hellenistic, Roman, Byzantine and Islamic periods. The collection includes Seleucid, Hellenistic municipal, Hasmonean, Roman imperial, Late Roman, Byzantine, and Islamic coins, with geographic and temporal context provided for settlement history understanding.

articles.title: Cooler and drier conditions increase parasitism in subtropical damselfly populations
articles.abstract: The study examines how parasitism fluctuates seasonally in damselfly populations within subtropical regions. Researchers found that parasite prevalence and intensity were greater during cooler seasons (autumn and winter) compared to hotter seasons and documented correlations between precipitation levels and infection rates.

articles.title: Goods and Ethnicity: Trade and Bazaars in Laos from a Gift Perspective - A Discussion
articles.abstract: The article examines trade and bazaar practices in Laos through the lens of gift exchange theory, analyzing how goods circulation relates to ethnic identity and social relationships in the Laotian context.

articles.title: Survival of the brightest: pIRIR dating of volcanic sediments in Sulawesi, Indonesia, using micro-aliquots of K-rich feldspar
articles.abstract: The study applies post-infrared infrared stimulated luminescence dating techniques to volcanic sediments from Sulawesi, Indonesia, using micro-aliquots of potassium-rich feldspar to establish chronologies for archaeological and geological contexts.

articles.title: The Digitalization of Local Owner-Operated Retail Outlets: How environmental and organizational factors drive the use of digital tools and applications
articles.abstract: The research investigates how local owner-operated retail businesses adopt and utilize digital tools and applications, examining the environmental and organizational factors that influence digitalization processes in small-scale retail operations.

articles.title: A shape-based heuristic for the detection of urban block artifacts in street networks
articles.abstract: The study presents a computational heuristic approach for detecting urban block artifacts within street network datasets, using shape-based analysis to identify anomalies and data quality issues in urban morphological studies.

articles.title: Herrschaft vom Pferderuecken - Reisekoenigtum zur Zeit Heinrichs IV.
articles.abstract: The article examines the practice of itinerant kingship during the reign of Henry IV, analyzing how medieval rulers exercised authority through continuous travel across their domains, governing from horseback.

articles.title: German Renewable Energy Policies and Their Implications for Local Land Use - Maize for Biogas From 2008 - 2018 in Brandenburg
articles.abstract: The study analyzes the impact of German renewable energy policies on agricultural land use in Brandenburg, focusing on maize cultivation for biogas production between 2008 and 2018, examining the spatial and environmental implications of energy transition policies.
